original_text: b'  I\'ve been meaning to write about this since I saw a one-page article on  the subject of RSS clogging websites\' bandwidth in NewScientist  back in June. But it wasn\'t until I saw  this  Slashdot story on the same subject that I knew I had to get my  thoughts down. A lot of sites are suffering from a big problem  mdash;  they are being systematically hammered by RSS newsreaders for new material  at regular intervals.        When I first came across RSS around two years ago and did some reading  up on it, it sounded like another interesting protocol for a nonproblem.  I wondered what was wrong with just refreshing a "What\'s new?" page.  (I have a natural scepticism towards new and exotic protocols.) Nonetheless,  after RSS established a niche in the realm of informing us,  rolling news style, of new network content, I recognised its usefulness  in this situation. I did still feel that its design was suboptimal, no  matter how many thousands of bloggers now relied on it.  '
refined_text:
The author has been contemplating writing about RSS and its impact on website bandwidth since reading an article in NewScientist. This topic was further emphasized by a Slashdot story on the same subject. The author notes that many websites are facing a significant problem: they are being repeatedly accessed by RSS newsreaders searching for new content. 

The author initially perceived RSS as a solution for a non-existent problem, questioning the need for it when a simple "What's New?" page refresh could achieve the same goal. However, they acknowledge the usefulness of RSS for keeping users informed about new content in a rolling news format, especially for bloggers who rely heavily on it. Despite its value, the author still believes that the design of RSS could be improved.

original_text: b'BHP Billiton has delivered the biggest profit ever achieved by an Australian company - a \\$US3.38billion (\\$4.73billion) whopper, up 78 per cent on last year. '
refined_text: BHP Billiton, an Australian company, achieved a record profit of $3.38 billion USD ($4.73 billion AUD). This profit represents a 78% increase compared to the previous year.

original_text: b'Palestinian officials scheduled presidential elections for Jan. 9, 2005, pushing forward with steps to a secure a new leader following the death of Yasser Arafat.'
refined_text: Palestinian authorities announced that presidential elections will take place on January 9, 2005. This decision is a step towards selecting a new leader following the passing of Yasser Arafat.

original_text: b'Families of the 202 victims who died in the bombings of two nightclubs in Bali have marked the second anniversary of the attacks with emotional ceremonies on the Indonesian resort island and in Australia.'
refined_text: The families of the 202 people who lost their lives in the bombings of two nightclubs in Bali held emotional ceremonies to commemorate the second anniversary of the attacks. These ceremonies were held both on the Indonesian resort island of Bali and in Australia.

original_text: b'Reuters - U.S. employment costs rose by\\slightly less than expected in the third quarter this year, up\\0.9 percent, as benefit costs posted their smallest rise since\\early 2002, a government report showed on Friday.'
refined_text: According to a government report released on Friday, U.S. employment costs increased in the third quarter of this year. The rise was 0.9%, which is slightly lower than anticipated. This increase was driven primarily by a smaller rise in benefit costs, which saw their smallest increase since early 2002.

original_text: b"AFP - Australia's foreign minister will pay a rare visit to North Korea this week for talks on its nuclear programme after creating a stir here by warning a North Korean missile would be able to hit Sydney."
refined_text: Australia's foreign minister will travel to North Korea this week for discussions about the country's nuclear program. This visit is unusual and comes after the minister warned that a North Korean missile could potentially reach Sydney, Australia.

original_text: b'Chennai: Internet major Yahoo Inc will own a 25-member high-skilled software professional team in Chennai, after it acquired US-based Stata Labs.'
refined_text: Yahoo Inc., a prominent internet company, has acquired Stata Labs, a United States-based software development firm. As a result of this acquisition, Yahoo will now have a team of 25 highly skilled software professionals based in Chennai, India.

original_text: b'As the first criminal trial stemming from the financial deals at Enron opens, it will be notable as much for who is not among the six defendants as who is.'
refined_text: The upcoming criminal trial related to Enron's financial dealings will be significant not only for the six defendants but also for the notable absence of certain individuals.

original_text: b'Oracle Corp., the world #39;s second-largest software firm, beat the Street with its first-quarter results after Tuesday #39;s market close thanks to stronger sales of its database software.'
refined_text: Oracle Corporation, the world's second-largest software company, surpassed analysts' expectations in its first-quarter results. This success was attributed to increased sales of their database software, which were announced after the market closed on Tuesday.

original_text: b'Reuters - A survivor of a massacre during Hindu-Muslim riots in Gujarat in 2002 told a court on Wednesday he recognised seven men from the night of the attack accused of killing 14 people by hacking or burning them to death.'
refined_text: A survivor of a massacre during Hindu-Muslim riots in Gujarat in 2002 testified in court that he recognized seven men who were accused of killing 14 people. The survivor identified these men as being present during the attack where the victims were killed by hacking or burning.

original_text: b'Israel signalled flexibility and openness toward the emerging new Palestinian leadership Friday, with a top adviser to Prime Minister Ariel Sharon saying peace talks could resume if the Palestinians showed some goodwill.'
refined_text: Israel expressed a willingness to be flexible and open to working with the new Palestinian leadership. A senior advisor to Prime Minister Ariel Sharon stated that peace negotiations could restart if the Palestinians demonstrate a positive attitude.

original_text: b' quot;We #39;re excited to bring the iTunes Music Store to even more music fans across Europe, and with this expansion we now reach customers in almost 70 percent of the global music market, quot; Apple #39;s Vice President of Applications Eddy Cue said.'
refined_text: Apple announced the expansion of the iTunes Music Store to more music fans across Europe. This expansion means that the store now reaches customers in nearly 70% of the global music market. Eddy Cue, Apple's Vice President of Applications, expressed excitement about bringing the store to more customers.

original_text: b'Products announced this week to streamline software-patch delivery are just part of Microsoft #39;s overall efforts to tighten system security, Scott Charney told attendees of the IT Forum in Copenhagen this week.'
refined_text: Microsoft has announced new products this week that aim to simplify software patch delivery. These products are part of Microsoft's broader efforts to improve system security. This announcement was made by Scott Charney at the IT Forum in Copenhagen this week.

original_text: b'The number of anti-Semitic attacks in France has more than doubled over the past year, with most of them committed for vague reasons rather than ideology, France #39;s interior minister said in an interview published on Friday.'
refined_text: France's interior minister stated that the number of anti-Semitic attacks in the country has more than doubled in the past year. The minister noted that most of these attacks were committed for unclear reasons rather than due to ideology.

original_text: b' JOHANNESBURG, South Africa (Reuters) - South African police  fired rubber pellets at township youths who blocked a highway  and burned tires Monday in a rare protest over poverty and  other grievances.'
refined_text: In Johannesburg, South Africa, police used rubber pellets to disperse township youths who blocked a highway and set tires on fire. This protest, which was unusual, was organized to express dissatisfaction with poverty and other issues.

original_text: b'Symantec Corp. has warned of a string of security holes in its Firewall/VPN Appliance and Gateway Security products, less than a month after its last firewall security problems.'
refined_text: Symantec Corporation has alerted users to a series of security vulnerabilities in its Firewall/VPN Appliance and Gateway Security products. This announcement comes less than a month after the company addressed previous security issues related to its firewall products.

original_text: b'Britain begins redeploying some 800 troops toward the restive area south of Baghdad area in a move aimed at freeing up US forces for an assault on insurgent areas north and west of the capital.'
refined_text: Britain is moving approximately 800 troops to the volatile region south of Baghdad. This action aims to allow American forces to focus on attacking insurgent positions north and west of the capital.

original_text: b' PUTRAJAYA, Malaysia (Reuters) - Malaysian rebel politician  Anwar Ibrahim failed on Wednesday in a final court bid to erase  his criminal record and to immediately rejoin active politics,  leaving a royal pardon as his only way back.'
refined_text: Anwar Ibrahim, a Malaysian politician, lost a final court appeal on Wednesday. This appeal aimed to clear his criminal record and allow him to immediately return to politics. Now, the only way for Anwar Ibrahim to rejoin active politics is to receive a royal pardon.

original_text: b'Prepared statements were flying like tickertape Tuesday, in the wake of ABC #39;s racy introductory skit on Monday Night Football.'
refined_text: On Tuesday, many prepared statements were released following a suggestive introductory skit aired during Monday Night Football on ABC.

original_text: b' BANGKOK (Reuters) - A second bomb exploded near a food  stall in southern Thailand on Friday, wounding at least nine  members of a bomb squad investigating an earlier blast that  wounded four people.'
refined_text: Two bomb explosions occurred in southern Thailand on Friday. The first explosion injured four people, while a second bomb detonated near a food stall while a bomb squad was investigating the initial blast. This second explosion resulted in injuries to at least nine members of the bomb squad.

original_text: b"Intel touts WiMax, but analysts say it likely won't go beyond niche applications."
refined_text: Intel is promoting WiMax technology, but industry analysts believe its use is likely to be limited to specific, specialized applications.

original_text: b'The meetings of Major League Baseball #39;s general managers officially open today in Key Biscayne, Fla., though Jim Bowden -- the GM of the franchise that is supposed to depart Montreal for Washington '
refined_text: Major League Baseball's general managers are meeting today in Key Biscayne, Florida. Jim Bowden, the general manager of the team relocating from Montreal to Washington, is present at the meeting.

original_text: b'KABUL, Afghanistan -- Weekend counting shows interim President Hamid Karzai is well ahead of his rivals and on course to become Afghanistan #39;s first popularly elected leader.'
refined_text: Weekend counting indicates that interim President Hamid Karzai is leading his opponents in the Afghan presidential election. He is likely to become Afghanistan's first democratically elected leader.

original_text: b'Description: The International Gymnastics Federation asks US gymnast Paul Hamm to give his Olympic all-around gold medal to South Korea #39;s Yang Tae-young.'
refined_text: The International Gymnastics Federation requested that American gymnast Paul Hamm return his Olympic all-around gold medal to Yang Tae-young, the South Korean gymnast who originally finished third.

original_text: b"The number of cars on China's roads is set to rise sevenfold to 140 million by 2020, according to government forecasts."
refined_text: China's government predicts that the number of cars on its roads will increase significantly by 2020. They estimate that the number will grow seven times larger, reaching a total of 140 million cars.

original_text: b'AP - Two new Internet domain names  #151; ".post" and ".travel"  #151; could appear online as early as next year as the Internet\'s key oversight board announced preliminary approval on Wednesday.'
refined_text: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) has preliminarily approved two new internet domain names: ".post" and ".travel". These new domain names could be available online as early as next year.

original_text: b"By BRUCE MEYERSON    NEW YORK (AP) -- A new cellular application promises to help vision-impaired people who can't read the screen of a mobile phone. It responds to spoken commands with voice recognition technology and reads back menu options, text messages, and other information to the user..."
refined_text: A new mobile application is designed to assist visually impaired individuals who struggle to read the screens of their phones. This application utilizes voice recognition technology to respond to spoken commands. It then reads aloud menu options, text messages, and other information to the user.

original_text: b'I #39;ve had my review unit of the PalmOne TungstenT5 for about 8 hours now, and I #39;m ready to make a first pass at PalmOne #39;s newest high-end model.'
refined_text: I have been using the PalmOne Tungsten T5 for approximately eight hours and am ready to provide an initial assessment of PalmOne's latest high-end device.

original_text: b'AP - A shaken President Vladimir Putin made a rare and candid admission of Russian weakness Saturday in the face of an "all-out war" by terrorists after more than 340 people  #151; nearly half of them children  #151; were killed in a hostage-taking at a southern school.'
refined_text: President Vladimir Putin acknowledged Russia's vulnerability in a rare public statement. He described the situation as an "all-out war" by terrorists following the deaths of over 340 people, including nearly half who were children, during a hostage situation at a school in southern Russia.

original_text: b"Russell T. Jones, the rap artist known as O.D.B., was a founding member of the Wu-Tang Clan and made a large imprint on rap music in the 1990's."
refined_text: Russell T. Jones, better known as the rapper O.D.B., was a founding member of the Wu-Tang Clan. He significantly influenced rap music during the 1990s.

original_text: b'Nation needs government help to maintain competitive edge, group says.'
refined_text: A group argues that the nation requires government support to remain competitive.

original_text: b'AP - U.N. Secretary-General Kofi Annan, fending off Republican demands for his resignation over alleged corruption, said Thursday he will expand U.N. support for Iraqi elections if need be. He said he was not offended that President Bush did not ask to see him during this visit to Washington.'
refined_text: United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan has stated that he will increase the UN's support for Iraqi elections if necessary. He made this statement while addressing Republican demands for his resignation over alleged corruption. He also said that he was not upset that President Bush did not meet with him during his recent visit to Washington.

original_text: b'NEW YORK - Investigators found the remains of two people believed to be former Mafia captains at a vacant lot apparently used for years as a graveyard for people ordered killed by the late mob boss John Gotti and other gangsters, authorities said.    Searchers recovered bones and other tissue in a shoe, ribs, a partial jaw and teeth and two personal items that led investigators to believe they had the remains of Bonanno crime family captains Philip Giaccone and Dominick Trinchera, law enforcement officials familiar with the dig said Tuesday on condition of anonymity...'
refined_text: Investigators discovered human remains at a vacant lot in New York City. The remains are believed to belong to two former Mafia captains, Philip Giaccone and Dominick Trinchera, both associated with the Bonanno crime family. The lot is suspected of being a burial ground for individuals ordered killed by John Gotti and other mob bosses. The recovered remains include bones, tissue, ribs, a partial jaw with teeth, and personal items that support the identification of the two captains.

original_text: b"Reuters - Villagers returning to their\\homes in Sudan's Darfur region are living in fear of the Arab\\militiamen who initially drove them away, the United Nations\\said in a report received by Reuters Monday."
refined_text: Villagers returning to their homes in Sudan's Darfur region are living in fear of the Arab militiamen who initially forced them to leave, according to a United Nations report.

original_text: b" KIEV (Reuters) - Ukraine's main opposition leader and  presidential hopeful Viktor Yushchenko on Tuesday warned  politicians their lives could be in danger from a murderous  leadership bent on election victory."
refined_text: Viktor Yushchenko, Ukraine's leading opposition figure and a presidential candidate, issued a warning on Tuesday. He expressed concern that politicians might be in danger from the current leadership. Yushchenko believes the leadership is willing to resort to violence in order to secure victory in the upcoming election.

original_text: b'AOL said it was intent on making travel an important part of its content expansion, which increasingly includes general Web properties that all Internet users can access as well as content just '
refined_text: AOL stated its intention to make travel a significant part of its content expansion strategy. This expansion includes both general web properties accessible to all internet users and content specifically tailored for AOL users.

original_text: b'BLOOMFIELD TOWNSHIP, Mich. -- It #39;s not a Ryder Cup until there #39;s a controversy, invented or otherwise. On Wednesday the stage belonged to Phil Mickelson, who became a cause celebre by skipping a Ryder Cup '
refined_text: Phil Mickelson's absence from the Ryder Cup sparked controversy, highlighting the event's tradition of drama, whether real or fabricated.

original_text: b'FRX ECO INDUSAFIN ENG  2004-10-13 22:22:02 Fed #39;s McTeer tapped to head Texas A amp;M - UPDATE 1 WASHINGTON (AFX) -- Robert McTeer, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, said he would retire from his post if named, as '

refined_text: Violence in Iraq resulted in the deaths of 16 people on Wednesday, including one US Marine and three Polish soldiers. A bomb detonated near the office of a high-ranking Shiite cleric in Karbala.

original_text: b'Reuters - Leaders of the largest group for gay\\men and lesbians in the Republican Party voted overwhelmingly\\against endorsing President Bush for re-election because he\\favors a constitutional amendment banning same-sex marriage,\\The New York Times said on Wednesday.'
refined_text: The Republican Party's largest organization for gay and lesbian individuals voted against endorsing President Bush for re-election. This decision was made because President Bush supports a constitutional amendment prohibiting same-sex marriage. This information was reported by The New York Times on Wednesday.

original_text: b'Disney president says studio is pushing forward with sequels to popular animated films, Pixar or no. New York (CNN/Money) - The Walt Disney Company is pushing forward with plans to capitalize on the blowout '
refined_text: The Walt Disney Company is continuing to develop sequels to popular animated films, regardless of Pixar's involvement. This decision reflects Disney's desire to capitalize on the success of their existing animated franchises.

original_text: b"AP - Tiger Woods felt stiffness in his back after seven holes Wednesday and decided to call it a day, not wanting to aggravate the week-old injury and not entirely certain he would be able to defend his title in the American Express Championship. The way his year has gone, that's just his luck."
refined_text: Tiger Woods experienced back stiffness during the American Express Championship. After playing seven holes on Wednesday, he decided to stop playing to avoid worsening the injury, which he sustained a week prior.  Woods was unsure if he would be able to defend his title, expressing frustration at the timing of the injury.

original_text: b"Fidelity Investments' largest funds voted to oust Michael D. Eisner from the chairman's post at Walt Disney Co., in one of last year's biggest proxy battles, according to voting records the nation's largest mutual-fund firm has made public for the first time."
refined_text: Fidelity Investments, the largest mutual fund company in the United States, has publicly released its voting records for the first time. These records reveal that Fidelity's largest funds voted to remove Michael D. Eisner from his position as chairman of Walt Disney Company. This action was part of one of the largest proxy battles of the previous year.

original_text: b'Top-listed clothing retailer Marks  amp; Spencer MKS.L says it has completed the acquisition of women #39;s fashion label per una, keeping its design-guru owner George Davies at the helm.'
refined_text: Marks & Spencer, a leading clothing retailer, has acquired the women's fashion label, "per una." George Davies, the designer behind the brand, will continue to lead the label.

original_text: b'BBaiji - Three decapitated bodies were found north of Baghdad on Wednesday and are believed to be the corpses of foreigners, Iraqi security forces said.'
refined_text: On Wednesday, Iraqi security forces discovered three decapitated bodies north of Baghdad. They believe the bodies belong to foreigners.

original_text: b'South Korea and the United States agreed to push for an early resumption of negotiations to end the North Korean nuclear crisis as soon as the US presidential election comes to a close, top diplomats of the two nations said Tuesday.'
refined_text: South Korea and the United States have agreed to work together to restart negotiations aimed at resolving the North Korean nuclear issue.  This agreement was made by top diplomats from both countries and will come into effect after the US presidential election.

original_text: b'Princess Diana continues to fascinate her fans around the world even seven years after her tragic death. In an NBC News exclusive, for the first time, revealing new tapes are coming to light.'
refined_text: Princess Diana remains a captivating figure for her fans worldwide, even seven years after her passing. New audio recordings, exclusive to NBC News, will be released for the first time, offering previously unheard insights.

original_text: b'Cambodia is celebrating the arrival of its first new monarch in 60 years, as King Norodom Sihamoni returns home to assume the throne abdicated by his ailing father.'
refined_text: Cambodia is celebrating the arrival of its new king, Norodom Sihamoni. He is the first new monarch in 60 years and has returned home to take the throne. His father, the previous king, has abdicated due to his health.

original_text: b"NEW YORK - Stocks enjoyed a late-day rally Wednesday to finish higher despite a new record price for oil and gloomy third-quarter outlooks from several companies. Volume was relatively light as investors awaited the government's jobs creation report at the end of the week..."
refined_text: On Wednesday, the stock market experienced a late surge, ending the day with gains despite a new record high for oil prices and pessimistic third-quarter forecasts from several companies. Trading volume was relatively low as investors anticipated the release of the government's jobs report later in the week.

original_text: b'Contract with Department of Defense is part of homeland security boom.'
refined_text: The Department of Defense has entered into a contract. This contract is part of a larger trend of increased homeland security spending.

refined_text: The Connecticut team reached the W.N.B.A. Finals for the first time. They achieved this by defeating the Liberty on Sunday.  Taj McWilliams-Franklin contributed 18 points to the victory.

original_text: b' LONDON (Reuters) - Oil prices held firm around \\$55 a barrel  on Wednesday as traders braced for the start of the northern  winter with thin heating oil supplies.'
refined_text: Oil prices remained stable at approximately $55 per barrel on Wednesday. Traders were preparing for the beginning of winter in the Northern Hemisphere, anticipating low heating oil supplies.

refined_text: Jamal Crawford, the new young player for the Knicks this season, is known for his speed, hunger, and talent.  He has experience playing on struggling teams, having spent his entire NBA career with the Chicago Bulls.

refined_text: New methods for stealing money are being developed.

original_text: b' LONDON (Reuters) - Oil extended its retreat on Thursday,  taking two-day losses to 6 percent after an unexpectedly large  rise in U.S. crude inventories spurred speculative funds to  take profits out of record high prices.'
refined_text: Oil prices decreased on Thursday, continuing a two-day decline that amounted to a 6% drop. This decline was triggered by an unexpected increase in U.S. crude oil inventories, leading speculative investors to sell their holdings, taking profits from record high oil prices.

original_text: b'The founders of the money management firm Pilgrim Baxter  amp; Associates agreed yesterday to each pay \\$80 million in a settlement that resolves a longstanding complaint that they improperly profited '
refined_text: The founders of Pilgrim Baxter & Associates, a money management firm, agreed to each pay $80 million as part of a settlement. This settlement resolves a long-standing complaint that alleged the founders improperly profited from their actions.

original_text: b' LONDON (Reuters) - The dollar sank to a record low against  the euro and fell to its lowest level since January 2000 on the  yen on Thursday as the market tested how far Japan and Europe  would tolerate yen and euro gains on dollar weakness.'
refined_text: On Thursday, the US dollar experienced significant declines against both the euro and the Japanese yen. The euro reached a record high against the dollar, while the yen reached its highest point since January 2000. This market movement reflects the uncertainty surrounding how far Japan and Europe would allow the yen and euro to strengthen against a weakening dollar.

original_text: b" BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Turkey's Prime Minister kept the EU  waiting on Friday on whether he would accept the terms of its  historic offer to start accession negotiations, leaving  late-night talks with the bloc's presidency without a deal."
refined_text: On Friday, Turkey's Prime Minister did not immediately accept the European Union's offer to begin accession negotiations. This decision came after late-night discussions with the EU presidency, leaving the talks without an agreement.

original_text: b'New York Attorney General Eliot Spitzer on Friday filed suit against Universal Life Resources (ULR), charging the life and disability insurance broker with taking fraudulent kick-backs for steering business to certain insurers.'
refined_text: New York Attorney General Eliot Spitzer filed a lawsuit against Universal Life Resources (ULR), a life and disability insurance broker. The lawsuit accuses ULR of fraudulent activities, specifically taking kickbacks for directing clients to specific insurance companies.

original_text: b'Sony Computer Entertainment held a party in Tokyo yesterday to celebrate the completion of Polyphony Digital #39;s long-awaited Gran Turismo 4, which is set for release in Japan - and, apparently, in North America - this December.'
refined_text: Sony Computer Entertainment hosted a celebration in Tokyo for the completion of Polyphony Digital's Gran Turismo 4. The highly anticipated game is scheduled for release in Japan and North America this December.

original_text: b'England captain Michael Vaughan said on Monday that he expected an evenly matched series against South Africa but suggested his bowlers could hold the key.'
refined_text: England captain Michael Vaughan stated on Monday that he anticipates a closely contested series against South Africa. He also indicated that England's bowling attack could play a crucial role in determining the outcome of the series.

original_text: b'Parmalat #39;s government-appointed administrator sued Bank of America Corp. on Thursday, alleging that the bank helped executives at the dairy company hide debt and conceal its insolvency from investors.'

original_text: b'ARLINGTON, VA. -- Charlotte and Philadelphia will benefit by changes US Airways plans to make in its flight schedules in February.'
refined_text: US Airways plans to make changes to its flight schedules in February. These changes will benefit the cities of Charlotte and Philadelphia.

refined_text: Viktor Yushchenko, a presidential candidate in Ukraine, stated that the parliament's recent vote to address election irregularities creates a path for him to win a new election. He believes the previous election was rigged.

original_text: b'30 August 2004 -- Iran #39;s security chief, Hasan Rowhani, has assured visiting Iraqi officials that his country is committed to cooperating on establishing security in Iraq.'
refined_text: On August 30, 2004, Iran's security chief, Hasan Rowhani, met with Iraqi officials. During the meeting, Rowhani assured the Iraqi officials that Iran is committed to working with them to establish security in Iraq.

original_text: b'Portsmouth #39;s Harry Redknapp has been named as the Barclays manager of the month for October. Redknapp #39;s side were unbeaten during the month and maintained an impressive climb to ninth in the Premiership.'
refined_text: Harry Redknapp, manager of Portsmouth, was awarded the Barclays Manager of the Month award for October. Portsmouth remained undefeated during the month, resulting in a significant rise to ninth place in the Premiership.

original_text: b"AFP - A bomb alert forced a Virgin Atlantic flight from Hong Kong to London's Heathrow airport to land at Stansted airport, north of the British capital, as a  quot;precautionary measure quot;, officials said."
refined_text: A Virgin Atlantic flight from Hong Kong to London's Heathrow Airport was diverted to Stansted Airport, north of London, due to a bomb threat. The diversion was a precautionary measure, according to officials.

original_text: b'Dell will introduce Thursday a small music player to compete with Apple #39;s iPod mini. The new Pocket DJ 5 offers one GByte more memory, but is priced \\$50 less than Apple #39;s market dominating player.'
refined_text: Dell will release a new music player on Thursday, designed to compete with Apple's iPod mini.  The new player, called the Pocket DJ 5, has one gigabyte more memory than the iPod mini but costs $50 less.

original_text: b"Firefox 1.0 Available Today\\\\Firefox 1.0 (Preview Release) is now available. If you've never tried this wonderful browser it's MORE THAN worthy of your attention. What's new in this release?\\\\- Improved pop-up blocker: new pop-up blocker blocks even more pop-ups while making it easy to view pop-ups when necessary.\\\\- Security improvements: ..."
refined_text: Firefox 1.0, a preview release, is now available. This browser is highly recommended for anyone looking for a new browsing experience. original_text: b' GAZA (Reuters) - An Israeli missile hit the house of a  local Islamic Jihad leader in a refugee camp in the southern  Gaza Strip on Monday, wounding at least two people, Palestinian  medics said.'
refined_text: On Monday, an Israeli missile struck the home of an Islamic Jihad leader in a refugee camp located in the southern Gaza Strip.  Palestinian medical personnel reported that at least two individuals were injured in the attack.

original_text: b'Fort Worth, Texas - Blockbuster is tired of being the butt of jokes on Leno and Letterman. And, even closer to home, it wants to eliminate what the company #39;s president calls  quot;those unpleasant conversations at the register.'
refined_text: Blockbuster, a company based in Fort Worth, Texas, is seeking to change its public image. refined_text: The global population of wild animals has declined by 40% over the past three decades. This dramatic decrease is attributed to alterations in human lifestyles.

refined_text: The book "You Are a Loser" is a humorous read that also raises thought-provoking questions about the connection between humans and technology.  This review is by Amit Asaravala.

Harrigan, a long-time union official and advocate for corporate governance reform, was elected as CalPERS board president in February 2003. He previously led efforts to persuade institutional investors to withhold votes for Walt Disney's Michael D. Eisner as board chairman and for Safeway chief executive Steven A. Burd during a union strike against the company. Ron Alvarado will become the new president of CalPERS effective January 1st.

original_text: b"\\\\Using images to denote context has been within UIs for year.\\\\When Internet Explorer ipmlemented support for favicons I was really impressed.\\Gravatars  provide images for users and even FOAF provides support for\\associating an image with a profile.\\\\Rojo has a cool feature where we thumbnail blogs that don't provide images\\within their RSS feed.\\\\Here are two examples:\\\\My question is why can't I have Linux show me a thumbnail for processes while\\I'm switcing between them with Alt-Tab in KDE?  \\\\OS X can do it!  Windows XP can do it!\\\\"
refined_text:
##  Using Images to Represent Context in User Interfaces

The use of images to convey information about context is a well-established practice in user interfaces. For example, favicons are small images that represent websites in web browsers. 

Services like Gravatar provide images associated with user profiles, and FOAF (Friend of a Friend) offers support for associating images with profiles.

Even RSS feed aggregators, like Rojo, utilize thumbnail images for blogs that do not include images in their RSS feed.

This practice raises a question: why can't Linux operating systems, specifically KDE, display thumbnail images for running processes when switching between them using the Alt-Tab shortcut? 

Both OS X and Windows XP have this capability.

original_text: b'NAJAF, Aug 17: An Iraqi peace delegation urged Shia leader Moqtada Sadr on Tuesday to call off his uprising in Najaf, and on the battlefront US troops pounded militia positions near the country #39;s holiest sites. '
refined_text: An Iraqi peace delegation visited Shia leader Moqtada Sadr in Najaf on August 17th.  The delegation urged Sadr to end his uprising.  Meanwhile, US troops engaged in military actions against militia positions near Najaf's most sacred sites.

original_text: b'Digital musicians will have a few new riffs for their virtual production boards, at least those using the latest Apple software. Apple Computer on Wednesday announced new versions of its pro and midrange digital '
refined_text: Apple Computer has released updated versions of its professional and mid-range digital audio software. These updates will provide digital musicians with new features for their virtual production workflows.

original_text: b'Teenager Wayne Rooney has scored twice in the first 28 minutes of his debut for Manchester United in their Champions League Group D match against Fenerbahce of Turkey at Old Trafford.'
refined_text: Wayne Rooney, a teenager, scored two goals in the first 28 minutes of his first game for Manchester United. This game was a Champions League Group D match against Fenerbahce of Turkey, held at Old Trafford.

original_text: b" BEIJING (Reuters) - China sought Friday to soothe concerns  over a surprise interest rate rise, its first in nearly a  decade and one which is expected to kick off a series of  increases to cool growth in the world's seventh-biggest  economy."
refined_text: On Friday, China addressed concerns regarding a recent interest rate increase. This was the first such increase in almost ten years and is anticipated to be the start of a series of rate hikes aimed at controlling economic growth in the world's seventh largest economy.

original_text: b'US chipmaker AMD on Monday introduced a faster mobile chip, Athlon 64 processor 3000, for thin and light notebook computers. The new chip enables a powerful 32-bit computing '
refined_text: AMD, an American chip manufacturer, announced a new mobile processor called Athlon 64 processor 3000. This processor is designed for thin and light notebook computers and offers faster performance than previous models. The Athlon 64 processor 3000 enables powerful 32-bit computing.

original_text: b'Reuters - Some Mexican churches are\\using state-of-the-art technology developed by Israeli\\electronic warfare experts to silence cell phones that ring\\during mass, church officials said on Tuesday.'
refined_text: Some Mexican churches are utilizing advanced technology created by Israeli electronic warfare specialists to prevent cell phones from ringing during religious services. This technology effectively silences mobile devices, according to church officials.

original_text: b'AP - The Atlanta Braves made another huge pitch for success, getting Tim Hudson from Oakland. And the Seattle Mariners added another slugger, grabbing Adrian Beltre off the free-agent market.'
refined_text: The Atlanta Braves acquired pitcher Tim Hudson from the Oakland Athletics. The Seattle Mariners signed free agent Adrian Beltre, adding another power hitter to their lineup. Both moves are significant for their respective teams.

original_text: b'Company reports a decline in its router business during its quarterly earnings, which barely met analyst expectations.'
refined_text: The company's quarterly earnings report revealed a decrease in router sales. The financial results were just enough to meet analysts' predictions.

original_text: b'Matt Leinart led top-ranked U.S.C. shook off the fog and an early Oregon State threat to beat the Beavers.'
refined_text: Matt Leinart, quarterback of the top-ranked University of Southern California (USC) team, overcame an early challenge from Oregon State to lead his team to victory.

original_text: b'Sir Martin Sorrell said today that Ed Meyer, the 77-year-old chairman of Grey Global, was ready to accept his advice on how to make the company he has just sold much more profitable.'
refined_text: Sir Martin Sorrell stated that Ed Meyer, the chairman of Grey Global, is open to his suggestions on improving the profitability of the company Meyer recently sold.

original_text: b'Reuters - Namibian beef certified as\\"cheetah-friendly" will soon make its way to the European Union\\as part of a new strategy to reduce conflict between ranchers\\and the graceful cats.'
refined_text: Namibian beef has been certified as "cheetah-friendly" and will soon be exported to the European Union. This certification is part of a new strategy aimed at minimizing conflict between cattle ranchers and cheetahs.

original_text: b'The fate of British hostage Kenneth Bigley has come to encapsulate the unbridgeable division between the political establishment and the democratic hopes and concerns of working people.'
refined_text: The situation of British hostage Kenneth Bigley represents a significant divide between the political leadership and the beliefs and worries of ordinary citizens.

original_text: b"Illinois, off to a 7-0 start entering Thursday's game against Georgetown, felt all along it was the best team in the country."
refined_text: Illinois, with a perfect 7-0 record going into Thursday's game against Georgetown, believed they were the best team in the country.

original_text: b'KUALA LUMPUR : Thousands of supporters turned out at the airport to give Malaysia #39;s ex-deputy prime minister Anwar Ibrahim a rousing send-off as he headed for surgery in Germany on his second full day of freedom after six years in jail.'
refined_text: Anwar Ibrahim, Malaysia's former deputy prime minister, received a warm farewell from thousands of supporters at the airport as he departed for surgery in Germany. This occurred on his second full day of freedom after spending six years in prison.

original_text: b'THEY are the men who keep counter-terrorism experts awake at night, only too aware that a strike is being plotted even as you read this report.'
refined_text: These individuals are the focus of counter-terrorism experts' concerns. They are actively planning attacks, even as this report is being read.

original_text: b'The United Nations #39; special envoy to Sudan told the Security Council on Thursday that Darfur is sliding into anarchy as government and rebel forces battle over control of the territory.'
refined_text: The United Nations' special envoy to Sudan reported to the Security Council on Thursday that Darfur is facing escalating chaos. The envoy stated that government forces and rebel groups are engaged in conflict for control of the region.

original_text: b'Auburn #39;s Devin Aromashodu can #39;t hang on to a pass during the first quarter against Georgia in Auburn, Ala. Saturday, Nov. 13, 2003.'
refined_text: During the first quarter of the Auburn versus Georgia football game on Saturday, November 13, 2003, in Auburn, Alabama, Auburn's player Devin Aromashodu dropped a pass.

original_text: b"In this year's national reading group competition, the Racketeers stood alone as the only all-male outfit."
refined_text: The Racketeers were the only all-male team participating in this year's national reading group competition.

original_text: b'One of the ironies of Wednesdays flight of SpaceShipOne is that those who had the worst view of the flightand the drama that unfolded during the ascentwere the members of the media who came to report on the event.'
refined_text: The media members present to cover SpaceShipOne's flight on Wednesday had an ironic perspective. They, despite being there to report on the event, had the least favorable view of the flight and the unfolding drama during the ascent.

original_text: b'The creators of the Bofra worm, which exploits the recently discovered iFrame vulnerability in Internet Explorer, may have timed the release of their worm to throw Microsofts monthly patch cycle into disarray, say security experts.'
refined_text: Security experts believe that the creators of the Bofra worm, which exploits a recently discovered vulnerability in Internet Explorer, intentionally released their worm to disrupt Microsoft's monthly patch cycle. The worm leverages a flaw in the iFrame feature of Internet Explorer, potentially causing significant disruption.

original_text: b'China needs to do more to control spending on construction, factories and other  quot;fixed assets quot; to curb growth and cool inflation, state media reported Monday, citing top government officials.'
refined_text: Chinese government officials have stated that the country needs to reduce spending on construction, factories, and other fixed assets to control economic growth and combat inflation. This message was reported by state media on Monday.

refined_text: Major League Baseball officials and Orioles owner Peter Angelos are scheduled to continue discussions about relocating the Montreal Expos to Washington, D.C. for the 2005 season.

original_text: b'AP - Ashley Earley scored 21 points to lead No. 14 Vanderbilt over Siena 76-47 in the championship game of the Vanderbilt Tournament on Saturday.'
refined_text: Ashley Earley, playing for the 14th ranked Vanderbilt team, scored 21 points to lead her team to victory against Siena in the championship game of the Vanderbilt Tournament. Vanderbilt won the game with a final score of 76-47.

original_text: b' STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - Andre Agassi marched into the  Stockholm Open semifinals Friday, beating Spanish eighth seed  Fernando Verdasco 7-6, 6-2 in his hardest match of the  tournament.'
refined_text: Andre Agassi advanced to the Stockholm Open semifinals on Friday, defeating Spanish eighth seed Fernando Verdasco 7-6, 6-2. This was Agassi's most challenging match of the tournament.

original_text: b'Beleaguered Russian oil giant Yukos on Monday faces a court-imposed deadline to pay a multi-billion dollar tax bill.'
refined_text: Russian oil company Yukos is facing a court-ordered deadline to pay a large tax bill.

original_text: b'Reuters - Federal Reserve Governor Susan\\Bies on Thursday delivered an upbeat assessment of the U.S.\\economy, saying both the household and business sectors\\appeared to be in good shape.'
refined_text: Federal Reserve Governor Susan Bies gave a positive outlook on the U.S. economy. She stated that both households and businesses appear to be in good condition.

original_text: b'A board investigating the crash of NASA #39;s Genesis spacecraft found that the design for a key system was drawn backward, resulting in improper orientation of switches that were '
refined_text: An investigation into the crash of NASA's Genesis spacecraft revealed that a critical system was designed with reversed components. This error led to the switches in the system being improperly oriented.

original_text: b' NEW YORK (Reuters) - LaBranche   Co. <A HREF="http://www.investor.reuters.com/FullQuote.aspx?ticker=LAB.N target=/stocks/quickinfo/fullquote">LAB.N</A> , the largest  market-maker on the New York Stock Exchange trading floor, on  Monday posted a net loss for the third quarter amid a drop in  principal transcations and commissions.'
refined_text: LaBranche & Co., the largest market-maker on the New York Stock Exchange trading floor, reported a net loss for the third quarter. The loss was attributed to a decline in principal transactions and commissions.

original_text: b'A PlayStation 2 version of the hugely-anticipated Resident Evil 4 will be released in Japan at the end of 2005, Capcom has confirmed, ending the long-term exclusivity arrangement it had previously signed with Nintendo.'
refined_text: Capcom has announced that a PlayStation 2 version of Resident Evil 4 will be released in Japan at the end of 2005. This release breaks the exclusive arrangement Capcom previously had with Nintendo for the game.

original_text: b'An Elephant writes  quot;Groklaw is reporting, based on a ZDNet UK story, that Sun #39;s strategy for survival in the near future is based on trying to equate Linux with Red Hat, and then attack Red Hat as too small to support enterprises.'
refined_text: According to a report from Groklaw, based on a ZDNet UK story, Sun Microsystems is planning to survive by equating Linux with Red Hat and then criticizing Red Hat as being too small to adequately support large businesses.

original_text: b'Even in a year when college football #39;s No. 1- and 2-ranked teams remained that way from start to finish and will the play in the national championship, the Bowl Championship Series can #39;t escape scrutiny and controversy.'
refined_text: Even though the top two college football teams maintained their rankings throughout the season and will compete in the national championship, the Bowl Championship Series continues to face criticism and controversy.

original_text: b'Boston- Maybe this really is the Red Sox #39;s year. If it isn #39;t, explain how they could win a game like the one they did Saturday night?'
refined_text: The Boston Red Sox won a remarkable game on Saturday night, raising the question: could this be their year?

original_text: b'Head teachers in England could gain powers to tackle pupils carrying weapons, under government plans.'
refined_text: The government is considering giving head teachers in England the authority to address the issue of students carrying weapons.

original_text: b'At least seven people are confirmed dead as Typhoon Aere pounded northern Taiwan with high winds and heavy rain. The storm hit the area with maximum sustained winds of 130 kilometers-an-hour.'
refined_text: Typhoon Aere struck northern Taiwan with strong winds and heavy rain, resulting in the deaths of at least seven people. The storm's maximum sustained winds reached 130 kilometers per hour.

original_text: b'Reuters - The last Atlas 2 rocket was\\launched on Tuesday, putting a national security satellite into\\orbit after four days of delays caused mostly by stormy\\weather.'
refined_text: The final Atlas 2 rocket was launched on Tuesday. The launch successfully placed a national security satellite into orbit. The launch had been delayed for four days due to stormy weather.
